intro: Euphrasia asturica, commonly known as the Asturian eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers with dark markings. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along forest edges, preferring moist, shaded environments. Its leaves are opposite, oval-shaped, and have a hairy texture. Euphrasia asturica is valued for its medicinal properties, traditionally used to treat eye conditions and respiratory ailments.
